alert.note: Alert for Greenlee (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 09 at 9:56AM MST until October 10 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arizona... Gila River At Gila River at Duncan affecting Greenlee County. For the Upper Gila...including Gila River at Duncan, Gila River at Clifton, Gila River at Calva, Gila River near Solomon...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Gila River At Gila River at Duncan. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage: Water could begin to damage the dike structure that protects Duncan. At 18.0 feet, Bankfull Stage: Water near the top of the dike structure and may start causing erosion downstream of bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM MST Sunday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above action state this evening, crest at 18.4 feet tomorrow morning, and drop below action stage late Monday evening. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM MST.
